children.name: blessing
children.definition: protection and help from God, or words spoken to ask for this :phúc lành, lời chúc lành
examples: The mass always ends with a blessing.
blessing on
We ask God's blessing on Joan at this difficult time.
ask God's blessing on their pastoral work
give the blessing
The priest gave the blessing.
may God continue to give us his blessing
In Christ, we have been given every spiritual blessing, and the capacity to hear the Holy Spirit is one of those blessings.
bless[T]
1to ask God to protect sb or sth : chúc lành
The couple laterhadtheirmarriage blessedin their local parish church.
2to make sth holy : chúc lành (của lễ)
Then the priest blesses the bread and wine.

children.name: anoint
children.definition: to put oil or water on sb’s head or body, usually as part of a religious ceremony : xức dầu
examples: the anointed king
anoint sb with sth
He was anointed with sacred oil.
anointment[C or U]

children.name: sanctify
children.definition: formal toset apart as or declare holy:thánh hoá
examples: a small shrine was built to sanctify the site.

children.name: consecrate
children.definition: to officially make sth holy and able to be used for religious ceremonies:thánh hoá
examples: The new cathedral was completed and consecrated in 1962.
consecrated[adj] đã đượcthánh hoá
consecrated bread/ wine/ ground
The bones will be reburied inconsecrated ground.
consecration[ U ]sự thánh hoá
the consecration of the new bishop

children.name: baptism
children.definition: a Christian religious ceremony in which someone is touched or covered with water to welcome them into the Christian faith, and sometimes to officially name them:lễ rửa tội
examples: infant baptism
We were discussing the rite of Christian baptism.
baptismal[attri]
a baptismal font(=container for holding the water used at baptism)
baptize/ baptiseUK [T usually P] to make sb officially a member of the Christian Church in a service of baptism :rửa tội
[+ object + noun]Were you baptized a Catholic?
christening[C] a Christian ceremony at which a baby is given a name and made a member of the Christian Church:lễ rửa tội
We're going to my nephew's christening on Saturday.
christen[T] to give a baby a name at a Christian ceremony and make him or her a member of the Christian Church :làm phép rửa tội,rửa tội
She's being christened in June.
[+ noun]She was christened Maria.

children.name: confirmation
children.definition: (in the Christian Church) the rite at which a baptized person, especially one baptized as an infant, affirms Christian belief and is admitted as a full member of the Church:lễ thêm sức
examples: Parents are asked to encourage the children who received confirmation on April 1 to give it serious thought.
the kind of joy mixed with tears one finds at weddings and confirmations
The jail may be his favorite place to do confirmations.
confirm[T usually P] to accept someone formally as a full member of the Christian Church at a special ceremony:làm lễthêm sức

children.name: Communion
children.definition: Eucharist the Christian ceremony based on Jesus Christ's last meal with his disciples (= the first twelve men who believed in him):bí tích thánh thể
examples: the Christian service, ceremony, or sacrament commemorating the Last Supper, in which bread and wine are consecrated and consumed.
we went to an early morning Eucharist
the daily celebration of the Eucharist
Eucharist[S] the consecrated elements, especially the bread:bánh và rượu thánh
he was wheeled close to the altar to receive the Eucharist
Communion/ Holy Communionformal [U] a Christian ceremony based on Jesus Christ 's last meal with his disciples (= the twelve men who first believed in him) :bí tích thánh thể
Communion was celebrated once a month
communion service/ wine
Communion/ Holy Communionformal [U]the consecrated bread and wine administered and received at Communion.
the priests gave him Holy Communion
communicant[C] a person who is involved in Holy Communion (= a Christian religious ceremony) and is therefore considered to be an active member of a church :người chịu lễ ban thánh thể

children.name: rite
children.definition: a ceremony that is always performed in the same way, usually for religious purposes: nghi thức
examples: funeral/ marriage/ fertility rites
ancient fertility rites
These traditionalritesareperformedonly by the women of the village.
You have to go through an initiation rite before you become a full member.

children.name: sacrament
children.definition: an important religious ceremony in the Christian Church, such as baptism or communion:bí tích
examples: Thus baptism became one of the seven sacraments in the Roman Catholic church.

children.name: marriage
children.definition: the ceremony in which two people get married: lễ cưới, bí tích hôn phối
examples: The marriage took place at St Bartholomew’s Church.
marriage ceremony
the marriage ceremony took place on January 3

children.name: holy orders
children.definition: the ceremony by which sb becomes a priest in some parts of the Christian Church: bí tích truyền chức thánh
examples: take holy orders
Will you be taking holy orders?

children.name: penance
children.definition: a sacrament in which a member of the Church confesses sins to a priest and is given absolution: bí tích giải tội
examples: For centuries, confession or penance (as it was alternatively called) was the linchpin of the Catholic sacramental economy.
A few years ago our parish hosted several priests who provided unusual penance services.

children.name: anointing of the sick
children.definition: (in the Roman Catholic Church) the sacramental anointing of the ill or infirm with blessed oil: sức dầu bệnh nhân
examples: There will be Sacrament of the Anointing of the Sick at 2.30 pm.
The sacrament of Anointing of the Sick has not been called ‘Last Rites’ by the Church for some time.

children.name: to make sb a priest or saint
beatify
children.definition: to announce formally in the Roman Catholic Church that sb who is dead has lived a holy life, usually as the first stage in making that person a saint :phong á thánh
examples: he beatified Juan Diego, an Indian believed to have had a vision of the Virgin Mary in 1531
beatification[C or U] declaration by the Pope that a dead person is in a state of bliss, constituting a first step towards canonization and permitting public veneration.
a ceremony of beatification in St Peter's Square

children.name: canonize
children.definition: / canoniseUK  (in the Roman Catholic Church) to officially announce that a dead person is a saint : phong thánh
examples: he was the last English saint to be canonized prior to the Reformation
canonization/ canonisationUK [U](in the Roman Catholic Church) the official admission of a dead person into sainthood.
many parishioners wanted to attend church specifically to honour the canonization of Mother Teresa

children.name: consecrate
children.definition: to officially state in a special religious ceremony that sb is now a priest, bishop etc : thụ phong
examples: he was consecrated bishop of York
consecration[U]

children.name: ordain
children.definition: to officially make sb a priest or other religious leader, in a religious ceremony : thụ phong
examples: Desmond Tutu was ordained in 1960.
ordain sb (as) sth
The church voted to allow women to be ordained as priests.
He was ordained(as)a priest in Oxford cathedral in 1987.
ordination[C or U] the act or ceremony of making someone a priest or other religious leader:lễthụ phong
the ordination of women

children.name: celebrate
children.definition: to perform a religious ceremony, especially the Christian Mass:cử hành
examples: to celebrate Mass

children.name: confess
children.definition: to tell a priest or God about the wrong things you have done so that you can be forgiven:xưng tội
examples: to confess your sins
He knelt andconfessedhissin.
confession[C or U] when you tell a priest or God about the bad things that you have done :
Have you been to confession recently?
You mustgo to confession.
The priestheardhis confession.
a priest whohears confession.

children.name: excommunicate
children.definition: to punish someone by no longer allowing them to be a member of the Roman Catholic church :rút phép thông công
examples: Martin Luther was excommunicated by the Pope
excommunication[C or U]
he appealed against the papal sentence of excommunication

children.name: sacrifice
children.definition: to kill an animal or a person and offer them to a god or gods:hiến tế
examples: the goat was sacrificed at the shrine
Muslims may not eat any food that has been sacrificed to idols, but kosher is fine.
Five full-grown male bulls were killed and sacrificed to the gods and goddesses.
sacrifice[C or U] the act of killing an animal or person and offering them to a god or gods, or the animal, etc. that is offered : việc hiến tế/ vật hiến tế
The people offered a lamb on the altar as a sacrificefortheir sins.
they offer sacrifices to the spirits
a flat cake offered by the Romans as a sacrifice to their gods
the ancient laws of animal sacrifice
sacrificial[adj] offered as a sacrificehiến tế
The priest held up the head of the sacrificial goat.

children.name: genuflect
children.definition: to bend one or both knees when in church or a holy place as a sign of respect:quỳ gối
examples: People were genuflecting in front of the altar.
genuflection[C or U]

children.name: prostrate yourself
children.definition: prostrateyourselfto lie with the face down and arms stretched out, especially in obedience or worship :phủ phục
examples: she prostrated herself on the bare floor of the church
prostrate[adj] lying with the face down and arms stretched out, especially as a sign of respect or worship
there was a man praying before an idol, lying prostrate
they surged forward around the prostrate figure on the ground
prostration[C or U]
The Purification of Pride First of all, we should know why we do prostrations.

children.name: cross yourself
children.definition: crossyourselfUKspecialized when Christians cross themselves, they move their hand down and then across their face or chest, making the shape of a cross: làm dấu thánh giá
examples: Beatie crossed herself quickly at the mention of the dead

children.name: make the sign of the cross
children.definition: to makea Christian sign by tracing a cross from the forehead to the chest and to each shoulder, or in the air.
examples: For example, Muslims whisper Allah's name in the baby's ear, and Christians make the sign of the cross in water on his or her forehead.’
He frantically made the sign of the cross over his chest.’
‘Oh no… Lord, grant him mercy,’ Katherine said, making the sign of the cross on her chest.

children.name: enter the church
children.definition: go into/to become a priest : trở thành linh mục
examples: He was in his thirties when he decided to enter the church.

children.name: enter a convent
children.definition: to become a nun
